ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to become more proficient in both understanding the grammatical rules of French as well as speaking it.
Learned french grammar, improved french reading comprehension, and application of language in class
I improved my writing, reading and listening skills in French.

I learned a lot of French vocabulary and idiomatic expressions that I wouldn't have otherwise been exposed to. I also improved my aural abilities through the variety of different media in the class. Furthermore, I was introduced to many countries that speak French that I didn't learn about in highschool.
Grammar review, and reading of French easy books.
I learned how to greatly improve my French writing and speaking. Additionally, I feel more confident in my French abilities.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: The course was very well structured.

Strengths: I liked the way grammar was taught. It just clicked

Weaknesses: Auditory pieces of homework feel very outdated and somewhat like busy work.

Strengths - interesting novels to read 
Weaknesses - information overload, way material was presented by professor could have been way better

Because it lasted only a month, the material to cover everyday was a lot more compared to a regular semester. Therefore, there were times that I felt like we couldn't get deeper in some of our discussions of the reading or grammar material. 

We were always encouraged to speak in French, which helped a lot.

Weaknesses: Aural production was mostly memorization, I would have enjoyed to get some more conversational experience
Strengths: lots of new vocabulary, lots of content
The amount of practice sheets were a strength of the course. A weakness would be the pace, but that was mostly due to the summer scheduling.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely!
Only if you love the language or need to complete the lang requirement
Yes, to anyone who wants to learn French, this is an excellent but hard course.
No, it was a little too fast paced which made it difficult to engage with material meaningfully
Yes, if you are serious about French.
I would recommend this to another student as it greatly improves your French abilities, but I would warn them about the large workload.
